original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up on continued IMF confidence
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in the mid day trade, running on positive sentiments from International Monetary Fund deal hope after Chinese assurances, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was up 0.69 percent or 66.92 points to 9,709.86, while the most liquid index was up 0.28 percent or 8.10 points to 2,877.024 during 113o hours.
“Turnover is pretty strong and investors are waiting for firmer responses and are jumping in to invest while the sentiments last,” an analyst said.
There has been significant interest in banking and financial sector as there are potential conclusions towards the IMF agreement.
On Tuesday President Ranil Wickremesinghe told the Parliament that the IMF board approval for the program is expected in the third or fourth week of March.
Top gainers during mid day trade were Hatton National Bank, Dialog and Expolanka.

Hatton National Bank (HNB) has been doing significantly well due to the index being heavily undervalued as other banks and financial institutions have rerated upwards, pining up investors for HNB, an analyst said. (Colombo/Mar08/2023)
